author: Randy Glenfadden
title: Have Fun!! Make Friends!! Earn Lindens!!
text: Randy Glenfadden Posted 22 minutes ago Share Posted 22 minutes ago RISE Wrestling (Ring of International Stars Experience) is an International wrestling federation traveling the globe bringing you great wrestling. We strive to bring you an international experience as we tour many different countries. We seek new talent that has the drive & determination to be the best. Seeking male and female wrestlers, commentators(Must have in world voice), referees and valets/managers ( must have in world voice). Free training will be provided. When your training is completed, pay will be given for every show you take part in. Fill out the application below. If you are available weekday afternoons and /or Saturday afternoons please fill out the application or for questions or more information, please contact Randy Glenfadden (randyglenfadden) in world or on Discord Barbie#5182 ( RISE Talent Acquisition Manager) RISE Application: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeWLfLgMzng_NATD_bVF8BRimwaUf65ghZ7TdRiT0IV1NH_tA/viewform?usp=sf_link Link to comment Share on other sites More sharing options...

author: Harvey Barbee
title: San Diego, CA – Crash with Injuries on Hwy 163 near Washington St
text:
San Diego, CA (December 19, 2024) – Emergency crews responded to a car accident on Highway 163 near Washington St in San Diego on Wednesday afternoon. The collision, which occurred at approximately 12:24 p.m., resulted in at least one person sustaining injuries.
The California Highway Patrol confirmed that the injured individual was transported to a nearby hospital for treatment. The condition of the victim has not been disclosed. While details about the vehicles involved remain unclear, first responders worked to provide immediate medical assistance and secure the scene. Traffic in the area experienced disruptions as authorities initiated their investigation into the cause of the crash.
The circumstances of the collision are under investigation. Updates may follow as more information becomes available. Our thoughts are with the injured party, and we wish them a quick recovery.
Highway Accidents in California California's highways, including Highway 163 in San Diego, are frequently the site of traffic accidents due to their high usage and fast-moving traffic. Intersections near major roads, such as Washington St, are especially prone to collisions due to merging vehicles and abrupt lane changes.
The California Highway Patrol reports thousands of traffic accidents on state highways each year, with many resulting in injuries. Common causes include speeding, distracted driving, and following too closely. Despite ongoing efforts to improve highway safety, accidents remain a significant concern for drivers.
Following a highway accident, it is crucial for individuals to seek medical care, document the incident, and report the collision to local authorities. These steps ensure proper handling of any legal or insurance matters that may arise.
For more information or to receive help after an accident, contact Local Accident Reports.

author: Amira EL MASAITI
title: Tangier-Tetouan-Al Hoceima dam reservoirs exceed 904 million m3
text:
The General Directorate of Water, under the Ministry of Equipment and Water said Tuesday that the reservoirs of large dams located in the Tangier-Tetouan-Al Hoceima region have reached more than 904 million m3.
A report from the Directorate showed that the reservoirs of these dams, whose capacity exceeds 1.721 billion m3, have reached, to date, 904.24 million m3, representing a filling rate of 47.33%.
These dams recorded water inflows of approximately 50.95 million m3 over 3 days, following the heavy rains that fell in recent days in the various prefectures and provinces of the Tangier-Tetouan-Al Hoceima region, increasing from 853.29 million m3 (a filling rate of 44.67%) to 904.24 million m3 between March 8 and 11.
Five dams in the Loukkos hydraulic basin recorded a filling rate of more than 70%, which include Oued El Makhazine dam, the largest dam in the region, which reached a filling rate of approximately 72.82%, or 490 million m3, the Acharif Al Idrissi dam (82.99%/100.96 million m3), the Chefchaouen dam (98.39%/12.05 million m3), the Smir dam (74.85%/29.16 million m3) and the Nakhla dam (82.95%/3.49 million m3).
The report also notes that four dams in the basin recorded a filling rate varying between 30 and 70%, namely the Tangier Méditerranée dam which showed a filling rate of 65.41%, or 14.4 million m3, the El Kharroub dam (50.37%/95.06 million m3), the Ibn Battouta dam (38.6%/11.24 million m3) and the Moulay El Hassan Ben El Mahdi dam (46.35%/10.86 million m3).
The filling rate of the other dams in the basin was less than 30%. These are the April 9 dam, which recorded a filling rate of 20.88%, or 62.64 million m3, the Dar Khrofa dam (14.76%/70.9 million m3), the Abdelkrim Al Khattabi dam (25.04%/2.95 million m3), and the Joumoua dam (10.95%/0.56 million m3).

author: XAVI OLIVA
title: Una bona calçotada sense sortir de Barcelona
text:
Una bona calçotada sense sortir de Barcelona
La Bodega Joan (Rosselló, 164) i el Pasa Tapas (Dr. Aiguader, 6-8) ja són dos clàssics d’aquest tipus de menús a la ciutat comtal
XAVI OLIVA
No hi ha tradició més catalana des de novembre fins al mes d’abril que reunir-se amb la família i amics, encender un bon foc amb sarment, cuinar una bona quantitat de calçots, embolicar-los a posteriori en paper de diari per mantenir la calor – tot i que la tradició marca que s’han de servir en una teula – i, després de pelar-los amb les mans, sucar-los a la seva particular salsa, molt semblant al romesco, per portar-se’ls a la boca i regalar-se un bon tiberi amb la companyia d’un bon tall de carn a la brasa com la botifarra.
En ciutats com Barcelona és complex seguir la tradició que envolta a la mítica ceba de Valls fil per randa. Tot i que avui dia es poden preparar al forn, en la majoria de llars de la ciutat comtal és impossible encendre un foc per elaborar-los seguint el costum. Primer, per seguretat, i segon, perquè l’olor de ceba inundaria la casa del veí.
Per sort, no fa falta sortir de Barcelona per disfrutar d’aquesta menja. Existeixen opcions que mantenen viva la tradició en una ciutat tan cosmopolita. La Bodega Joan, en ple Eixample (Rosselló, 164), i el Pasa Tapas de la Barceloneta (Dr. Aiguader, 6-8) són dos clàssics on menjar-se una calçotada de veritat, servida en una teula, amb la seva salsa i acompanyada de carn a la brasa.
Menú calçotada a l’Eixample
Fundat per Balbina Garrido, natural de Castella i la Manxa, i el català Joan Balsells el 1942, es tracta d’un dels restaurants amb més història de Barcelona. Adaptant-se a cada moment i mantenint-se en el mateix local des que va néixer, la Bodega Joan ha mantingut la seva essència generació rere generació – ja en van tres – amb una carta atapeïda de receptes tradicionals de la cuina catalana i espanyola.
El seu menú calçotada és un dels més coneguts de la ciutat comtal. Per 33,50 € es pot disfrutar d’una teula amb 10 calçots amb la seva salsa i de segon una graellada de carns (pollastre, botifarra, cansalada viada i xurrasco) acompanyades amb patata al caliu, carxofes a la brasa i allioli. El toc dolç el posa la crema catalana de les postres i cada persona pot escollir una consumició a triar entre vi de la casa, cervesa, un refresc o aigua.
La Bodega Joan compta amb una carta plena de clàssics com els cargols a la llauna, el pop a la gallega, les braves, les croquetes o les tripes amb ‘cap i pota’. Destaca també la qualitat de les seves carns a la brasa, a més dels seus peixos. La carta també compta amb un assortiment d’arrossos i fideuà.
Calçotada a la Barceloneta
L’altra opció per fer una calçotada sense sortir de Barcelona és el Pasa Tapas. Aquest restaurant de la Barceloneta és una opció fantàstica per a grups grans, al saló privat, situat a la primera planta del local, pot allotjar fins a 250 persones. No només això, també disposa de pàrquing per als clients que puguin necessitar-ho.
El Pasa Tapas compta amb tres menús calçotada: dos per als carnívors i una opció vegetariana per 32 €. Les dues opcions amb carn difereixen en el segon plat. El menú de 29,50 € té botifarra de bolets amb mongetes i pollastre fet al forn, i el de 33,50€ permet escollir entre una tira de costellam a la graella o una graellada de carns a la brasa. Els tres menús venen amb una teula de calçots preparats amb llenya de sarment i acompanyats de la tradicional salsa romesco que, per cert, és de les millors de la ciutat comtal.
Aquest restaurant ja compta amb gairebé trenta anys d’història a l’esquena. El servei pròxim i la seva cuina mediterrània han sigut el secret del seu èxit. La seva carta compta amb tapes, un bon assortiment d’arrossos, peixos i carns a la brasa, entre altres opcions. Tot això, amb producte fresc i de temporada.
La seva cuina obre en horari ininterromput fins a les 2.30 h de la matinada, també per a les comandes de Glovo.
BODEGA JOAN
C/ Roselló, 164. Tel. 932 204 756
www.bodegajoan.com
PASA TAPAS
C/ del Dr. Aiguader, 8. Tel. 930 464 097
www.pasatapas.com

author: Guest
title: Democrats dominated 2023 with wins on abortion rights, labor
text: 2023 was a good year for Democrats and their issues at the ballot box. Virginia put MAGA-allied politicians with higher aspirations, such as Gov. Glenn Youngkin, on notice. Democrats maintained control of the Virginia Senate and regained control of its House control, halting Youngkin's agenda for his final two years in office. That's a victory for Democrats. Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear won an unlikely reelection. This provided Democrats with an interesting snapshot into how to govern and campaign in a progressive way yet connect with a challenging electorate. That's another victory for the left. Two ballot initiative in Ohio favored Democratic positions. The first was a crass attempt by Ohio Republicans to head off a November ballot measure protecting a woman’s right to choose. By conducting a special election aimed at requiring a supermajority for public ballot measures to become law, this measure challenged both women’s rights and our democracy. The vote wasn’t close in what has become a deeply Republican state. People are also reading… Then on the November ballot, a measure protecting reproductive choice passed by a similar margin. These electoral victories make a difference. Just look at two Midwestern states that used Democratic majorities paired with Democratic governors to gain a range of legislative victories. In Michigan and Minnesota, Democratic control brought gun safety laws, protections for reproductive rights and LGBTQ+ communities, climate-friendly measures and more ability of workers to organize. Labor, a traditional Democratic bloc, repeatedly made gains this past year by standing up, speaking out and winning favorable contracts. Workers already had notched victories at Amazon and Starbucks in 2022. This trend continued in 2023 with the headline-grabbing strikes for writers in the entertainment industry and auto workers. Sometimes victory comes more in the form of problems for your opponents. The year 2023 proved that point for Democrats with a stack of woes for Republicans. It was hard not to see that the Republican Party remains wrapped tightly around the little finger of dictator-in-waiting Donald Trump. His legal woes -- business wrongdoing in New York, the careless handling of sensitive documents, and insurrectionist behavior on a national scale -- contrast nicely for Democrats against their governing and electoral successes. The Republican-controlled House of Representatives provides another contrast with its chaotic and dysfunctional running of the people’s business. Leadership elections seems pretty straightforward. The party with the most members elects a speaker and goes about its work. Not so with the 2023 Republican House Caucus. It took four days and 15 votes to get Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., as their speaker. Then came a series of bizarre and fruitless political projects including committee hearings, impeachment inquiries and bills with no meaningful results for the people. The one exception was a deal McCarthy finally made on the most basic of functions -- funding the government. But that promptly cost him his job. Did the chaos subside? Well, no. More speaker votes and infighting followed over the next three weeks until Rep. Mike Johnson, R-La., was finally elected speaker. The sum of this very public display of broken and unfit leadership for Republicans can be seen as nothing other than a victory for Democrats. So a quick review of the naughty vs. nice list shows Republicans with a 2023 record filled with dysfunction, contrasting nicely with the Democrats' roster of electoral, legislative and ally victories. Yes, 2023 was a good year for Democrats. Kusler is the national director of Americans for Democratic Action: [adaction.org](https://adaction.org/). He wrote this for [InsideSources.com](http://InsideSources.com).

author: РИА Новости Крым
title: Подрядчик затормозил стройку школы в Симферополе - Лента новостей Крыма
text:
СИМФЕРОПОЛЬ, 26 июн – РИА Новости Крым. Прокуратура Крыма выявила нарушения в работе подрядчика при завершении строительства школы на 500 мест в симферопольском микрорайоне Марьино. Об этом сообщает пресс-служба надзорного ведомства по итогам выезда на объект прокурора Киевского района города Андрея Семерока.
По данным прокуратуры, контракт с крымским подрядчиком о завершении строительно-монтажных работ предполагал обследование объекта в марте-апреле 2025 года и начало стройки в мае.
"В ходе выезда установлено, что обследование объекта не завершено, производство строительных работ не осуществляется", - сказано в сообщении.
В этой связи гендиректору подрядной организации объявлено предостережение. Завершение строительно-монтажных работ и ввод в эксплуатацию здания школы находятся под контролем прокурора района.
Строительство общеобразовательной
школы на 500 мест в Симферополе в микрорайоне Марьино завершится к сентябрю 2027 года, сообщал ранее глава Крыма Сергей Аксенов в своем ТГ-канале. Проведение работ ранее было приостановлено по вине недобросовестного подрядчика, уточнял он.

author: PA News Agency
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | East London and West Essex Guardian Series
text: Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit. Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday. Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected. They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am. Operations director Andy Smith said: “This has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and I’m grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.” National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck. Three men died after their 4×4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said. A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday. Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a “localised tornado” in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook. Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighbours’ houses “are an absolute disaster” with missing roofs and “squished” cars. Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said. ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults. Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day. In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday. Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel. Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal. The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground. Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: “Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.” Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules.
